title: Flight Disruptions Rise Amid Shutdown, Trump Proposes $10K Controller Bonus
snippets: Trump said on social media that he wasn't happy with controllers who called out of work, and suggested a $10,000 bonus for those who didn't take any time off during the shutdown.
Trump tells air traffic controllers to return to work as flight cancellations jump Reuters
While Trump threatens controllers, US flight cancellations will drag on even after shutdown ends AP News
Trump threatens to cut air traffic controllers' pay Axios
Flight delays and cancellations piled up in recent days as air traffic controller staffing shortages worsen in the government shutdown.

The president sharply criticized air traffic controllers who took time off during the shutdown, saying he's "NOT HAPPY" with them.
The new restrictions come less than a week after the FAA ordered commercial airlines to cut flights due to air traffic controller staffing shortfalls.
The impacts of the ongoing government shutdown have reached the wealthiest fliers, with 12 major US airports now closed to private jets.
titles: Trump slams air traffic controllers who called out during the government shutdown

summary: During the government shutdown, flight delays and cancellations increased due to air traffic controller staffing shortages. President Trump criticized controllers who took time off and suggested a $10,000 bonus for those who didn't. He also threatened to cut pay and warned of work requirements, as he urged controllers to return to their jobs to mitigate the disruptions. The FAA had previously ordered airlines to cut flights because of these shortages, affecting flights across the US, including the closure of 12 major airports to private jets.

At least eight people were killed on Monday in a car explosion near the historic Red Fort in a densely populated area of the Indian capital of New Delhi, a police spokesperson said. It was a rare blast in the heavily guarded city of more than 30 million people.
Police confirmed there were fatalities from a car explosion near a metro station close to the Red Fort landmark.

Authorities and emergency services responded to the scene.

These pardons, described by the Trump administration as part of a "national reconciliation" effort, affect those who supported Trump's unfounded claims of election fraud and engaged in actions such as pressuring Vice President Pence and organizing fake electors. Despite the federal clemency, some individuals may still face legal challenges at the state level.

title: Supreme Court Rejects Appeal to Overturn Same-Sex Marriage Legalization
snippets: The challenge to the court's 2015 ruling came from Kim Davis, the former Kentucky clerk who refused to issue same-sex licenses after the court's Obergefell v. Hodges decision, which recognized a constitutional right to same-sex marriage.

The U.S. Supreme Court rejected on Monday a bid by a former Kentucky county official to overturn its landmark 2015 ruling legalizing same-sex marriage nationwide, as the justices steered clear of the contentious case some 3-1/2 years after its conservative majority reversed abortion rights.

summary: The U.S. Supreme Court declined an appeal from Kim Davis, a former Kentucky clerk who refused to issue marriage licenses to same-sex couples, to overturn its 2015 decision in Obergefell v. Hodges that legalized same-sex marriage nationwide. The justices rejected the challenge without comment, maintaining the legal status of same-sex marriage.

title: Canada Loses Measles Elimination Status Amid Outbreak
snippets: Canada loses measles elimination status after three decades Reuters
A large, ongoing outbreak that began in Canada in 2024 has cost the country its measles elimination status.
Canada virtually eliminated measles in 1998. Now, a disease that doctors in the country knew only from textbooks is back.
The disease was once considered eliminated in Canada, but not any more — there have been more than 5,000 cases in the last 12 months as vaccination rates have fallen.
Measles is the most contagious infectious disease known to mankind, but the measles vaccine is highly effective at preventing it.

TORONTO — Canada has officially lost the measles elimination status it had held since 1998, causing the entire region of the Americas to also lose the designation. The status is granted and revoked by the Pan American Health Organization, the World Health Organization’s office for countries in North

summary: Canada has lost its measles elimination status, a designation held since 1998, due to an ongoing outbreak with over 5,000 cases reported in the last year. This loss also affects the entire Americas region's status. The outbreak marks the return of a disease once considered virtually eradicated in Canada, attributed to declining vaccination rates. The measles vaccine is known for its high effectiveness against the highly contagious disease.

title: Basketball Legend Lenny Wilkens Dies at 88
snippets: Lenny Wilkens, a three-time inductee into the Basketball Hall of Fame who was enshrined as both a player and a coach, has died, his family said Sunday. He was 88. The family said Wilkens was surrounded by loved ones when he died and did not immediately release a cause of death.

SEATTLE — Lenny Wilkens, a three-time inductee into the Basketball Hall of Fame who was enshrined as both a player and a coach, has died, his family said Sunday. He was 88. The family said Wilkens was surrounded by loved ones when he died and did not immediately release a cause of death. Wilkens was one of the finest point guards of his era who later brought his calm and savvy style to the sideline, first as a player-coach and then evolving into one of the game’s great coaches. He coached 2,487 games in the NBA, which is still a record. He became a Hall of Famer as a player, as a coach and...
titles: Hall of Famer and former Raptors coach Lenny Wilkens dies at 88
Lenny Wilkens Dies at 88, Hall of Famer Won 1979 NBA Title as SuperSonics HC - Bleacher Report
Former Raptors head coach Lenny Wilkens dead at 88
summary: Lenny Wilkens, a celebrated figure in basketball known for his achievements both as a player and a coach, has passed away at the age of 88. His family confirmed his death, stating he was surrounded by loved ones. Wilkens, a three-time Basketball Hall of Fame inductee, held the record for coaching 2,487 NBA games and led the Seattle SuperSonics to an NBA title in 1979. The cause of his death was not disclosed.

title: MLB Sets $200 Limit on Pitch Bets, Bans Parlays After Scandal
snippets: Prominent U.S. sportsbooks are establishing a betting limit on baseball wagers centered on individual pitches in an attempt to decrease manipulation, MLB announced.

Major League Baseball said its authorized gaming operators will cap bets on individual pitches at $200 and exclude them from parlays, a day after two Cleveland Guardians were indicted and accused of rigging pitches at the behest of gamblers.
titles: MLB, sportsbooks agree to limit on pitch bets
MLB, sports books cap bets on individual pitches
summary: Major League Baseball announced that authorized gaming operators will implement a $200 betting limit on individual pitches and prohibit such bets from being included in parlays. This move aims to reduce manipulation following the indictment of two Cleveland Guardians players accused of rigging pitches for gamblers.

title: Joe Burrow Returns to Practice After Surgery, Eyes Season Comeback
snippets: Bengals quarterback Joe Burrow, who hasn't played since Week 2 after having surgery to repair a turf toe injury to his left foot, is returning to practice Monday in a limited capacity.
Burrow is using the next few weeks to determine whether he will play again this season
titles: Burrow back to practice as 21-day window opens
Joe Burrow makes surprising practice return as Bengals open his 21-day injury window
summary: Bengals quarterback Joe Burrow, sidelined since Week 2 due to surgery on a turf toe injury on his left foot, is returning to practice in a limited capacity. His participation over the coming weeks will help decide if he can return to play this season.

title: US Airlines Hit by Disruptions; 1,700 Flights Canceled Amid Shutdown
snippets: US airline havoc continues with over 1,700 cancellations and 5,000 delays despite signs shutdown may be ending.
The pain Americans are facing at airports across the country is expected to get worse this week if Congress is unable to reach a deal to reopen the federal government.
titles: US airline disruptions persist amid prolonged government shutdown chaos
Flight cancellations and delays in U.S. continue to worsen amid government shutdown
summary: US airline operations faced severe disruptions, with over 1,700 flights canceled and 5,000 delayed. The issues persist amidst indications that the government shutdown might be concluding. The situation at airports could worsen if Congress does not reach an agreement to reopen the federal government.

title: 8 Lawmakers Join GOP to End US Shutdown; House to Reconvene
snippets: Seven Democrats and one independent voted with Republicans Sunday night to reopen the US government to end the shutdown.
House Speaker Mike Johnson spoke Monday morning about next steps in ending the government shutdown, saying he will call the House back as soon as the Senate passes a government funding bill.
Johnson on Monday laid out a timeline for what's next after the Senate advanced a short-term funding bill on Sunday, saying he will call the House back as soon as the Senate passes a funding bill.
titles: Speaker Johnson says House will return to Washington for shutdown deal vote
WATCH:  Johnson tells House to begin returning to Washington to start end of shutdown
WATCH:  House Speaker Mike Johnson gives timeline to end shutdown
summary: Eight lawmakers, including seven Democrats and one independent, voted with Republicans to end the US government shutdown. House Speaker Mike Johnson announced plans to reconvene the House following the Senate's passage of a short-term funding bill. Johnson's statement came after the Senate advanced the bill to reopen the government.

titles: Woman stabbed in neck in unprovoked attack at Birmingham bus stop dies
Man charged with murder after woman stabbed in Birmingham dies
summary: Katie Fox, 34, died from a serious neck wound after being stabbed on Friday night outside the Bullring shopping centre in Birmingham. She was taken to the hospital but succumbed to her injuries. A man has been charged with her murder following the attack.

title: New Solar Cell Hits Record 33.6% Efficiency with Dual Buffer Layer
snippets: Flexible perovskite/silicon tandem solar cells with 33.6% efficiency Nature
Flexible perovskite/silicon tandem solar cell with a dual buffer layer Nature
titles: Flexible perovskite/silicon tandem solar cells with 33.6% efficiency - Nature
Flexible perovskite/silicon tandem solar cell with a dual buffer layer - Nature
summary: Researchers have developed a flexible perovskite/silicon tandem solar cell with a dual buffer layer, achieving a record efficiency of 33.6%. This advancement, published in Nature, marks a significant step forward in solar cell technology.
